Q1.question: If every event in Scrum is an opportunity to inspect and adapt, which two contribute to continuous improvement?
Q1.green: The sprint review and sprint planning.

Q2.question: You are working with an agile team, which of the observations below would be an example of them applying an agile way of working?
Q2.red: The team will collaborate in groups to deliver all the work for each item.
Q2.blue: Only the coding work is done and all testing is left until integration.
Q2.green: All code work is done by programmers before handing to QA for test.
Q2.yellow: Each developer completes all work on the item assigned to them.

Q3.question: The primary advantages of using Agile over traditional methods, is _________________.
Q3.red: Increased customer satisfaction through regular feedback.
Q3.green: The same work can be completed with fewer developers.

Q4.question: Agile teams can improve the velocity they achieve during delivery by . . .
Q4.red: Carrying out more analysis on items during refinement.
Q4.blue: Increasing the number of people on the team.
Q4.green: Forecasting more work during planning sessions.

Q5.question: To avoid scaling issues in Agile deliveries, the organisation SHOULD apply which of the following options?
Q5.green: Send their staff on an Agile training course.

Q6.question: The Lean Muda or seven deadly wastes does not includes __________________.

Q7.question: When an Agile team is self-organising what does this mean?
Q7.green: They decide how to deliver items of work that will build the solution.
Q7.yellow: They decide who should get promoted within the organisation.
Q7.red: They should decide if they need to work in the office or from home.
Q7.blue: They decide what items to be delivered provide value.

Q8.question: Work in progress limits often prevent teams starting new items until those currently in progress are completed. Which of the below frameworks creates a sense of urgency by applying these limits?

Q9.question: Robert is working as a Test Manager at TPT Limited. James an intern working with Robert suggest for testing only once at the end of the project instead of testing continuously. What should be Robert's response in this case?
Q9.red: Explain to them the cost of finding defects at the end of a project can be massive and outweigh the cost of testing incrementally throughout the project.
Q9.blue: Accept this and add a few sprints at the end of the project for testing and bug fixing.
Q9.yellow: Ask them to test at least the most important features.
Q9.green: Accept this and have the development team test the project themselves.
